intro: [WRONG START] Santalum paniculumat var. chartaceum, commonly known as the paper-leaf sandalwood, is a species of flowering plant in the family Santalaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive papery, thin leaves that give it its common name. The plant is a hemiparasitic species, meaning it derives some of its nutrients from other plants through specialized root structures. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including Indonesia and the Philippines. The wood of this species is valued for its aromatic properties and is used in traditional crafts and incense.
